properties.address: Holy Trinity Church, Leytonstone, Greater London E11 4LD
properties.description: Space open to all people, offering free tea, coffee and snacks. There is an opportunity to shop for food essentials both fresh and non perishable from the community pantry. £3 buys £35+ worth of shopping. We serve free, nutritious and delicious breakfast and lunch from the Food Truck in partnership with The Skills Within. We can provide signposting and support to housing, health and wellbeing services. We are delighted to work with a digital artist to provide art courses for well being and a full Christmas dinner at Christmas from the local pub - the Leytonstone Tavern! The Food Share is a community where people are seen, heard and find space to belong. You are welcome here. Wheelchair access and toilet facilities, buggy access, creche facilities, baby changing, and all meals are vegan. All are welcome here, regardless of faith, sexuality, or gender orientation. This is a space where everyone is celebrated, respected, and valued for who they are. We believe in the inherent dignity and worth of every individual, and we strive to create a community where all feel safe, included, and empowered.
properties.title: Community Food Share

properties.description: Situated in the heart of Ilford for over 200 years, our church family comes from all over the world and we celebrate being a family that welcomes diverse cultures and languages. We have a wide range of facilities for children, parents and all age adults irrespective of religion, age or ethnicity. A daily offering of a welcoming atmosphere, with free hot drinks and biscuits! * Knitting Group – Mondays at 10.30am: make friends, drink tea and coffee as you knit. * Coffee Morning and Toddlers – our Tuesday morning coffee morning. Free refreshments, board games and relaxing chat for adults and toys for pre-school and babies. * English Classes (Language Link) – supporting women and men to learn English. Women - Wednesdays & Thursdays 10am-12pm. Men - Thursdays & Fridays 10am-12pm. * AMPED children's Club each Friday from 6.45-8pm. Games, Sport and Quizzes on a Biblical theme for everybody. * Jeta e Re is a drop-in for Albanian speakers and friends. We have a children's programme and support for ESOL classes too. Saturdays 2-5pm.

We also have a bookshelf of books that you're welcome to take one home from or bring one to add to and offer a range of arts and crafts and well being sessions from time to time so come along and say hi.

properties.title: Upminster Library

properties.description: The Renewal Programme have launched their Stay Warm in Newham project and have opened their first warm bank on Tuesday 24th January 2023. Newham residents are encouraged to attend our warm bank sessions to access energy- related advice/services and activities, to help reduce energy cost. We also provide a welcoming space for residents to enjoy tea and coffee with some company. Our warm bank runs three days a week on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at The Renewal Programme. You will have the opportunity to engage with our energy experts, Groundwork’s Green Doctors, who will be there every Tuesday to offer advice to residents on how to reduce energy cost while keeping their home warm. They also provide in-depth referrals via telephone calls or home visits (subject to eligibility). We are also providing hot meals every Wednesdays from 12:00pm- 1:00pm. We have a wide range of halal and vegetarian options. Everyone is welcome from Newham!
properties.title: Warm Bank

properties.description: In a prime riverside location Waterfront Leisure Centre is a fantastic multi-use community sport and leisure facility located in the heart of Woolwich, SE18. It boasts a modern newly refurbished 150 plus station gym with the latest Technogym cardiovascular, strength and resistance machines. A new functional fitness area is the perfect place for a HIIT work out and two further studios host a wide variety of Fitness Classes for all ages and abilities. This includes a multi purpose black out studio for interactive group cycle and yoga classes. The centre has a 25m fitness pool and a leisure pool with slides and a wave machine, sauna and Jacuzzi making it the perfect place for all your water activities including our Better Swim School lessons, aqua aerobics, fitness swims and family sessions. Facilities available for hire include a multi-use sports hall, indoor 5-a-side pitch and squash courts. Waterfront Leisure Centre is conveniently located, only a short walk from Woolwich DLR Station and the new Elizabeth Line Tube Station. There are excellent road, bus and train links from Greenwich, Charlton, Blackheath, Plumstead, Belvedere and Erith and Kent. We look forward to welcoming you very soon.
properties.title: Waterfront Leisure Centre

properties.description: we invite you to our Warm Space on a Tuesday, Thursday and Friday from 10am to 2pm During this time we provide free tea/coffee and cake as well as soup and a roll from 12noon. properties.title: Bromley Central Library

properties.description: Monday – every 2nd and 4th Monday afternoon of the month we have a ‘Crafternoon’ craft club – 1:30pm-3pm. Tuesday – Café open 10am-2pm; Wednesday – Café open 10am-2pm; Bible study 10:15am; Alpha course starting 11 January – 7:30pm including dinner Thursday – Café open 10am-2pm; Community choir including hot drinks – 10:30am-12pm; Friendship club 1:20-2:30pm Sunday – church service 10am

hours._text:
Monday – every 2nd and 4th Monday afternoon of the month we have a ‘Crafternoon’ craft club – 1:30pm-3pm.

Tuesday – Café open 10am-2pm;

Wednesday – Café open 10am-2pm; Bible study 10:15am; Alpha course starting 11 January – 7:30pm including dinner

Thursday – Café open 10am-2pm; Community choir including hot drinks – 10:30am-12pm; Friendship club 1:20-2:30pm

Sunday – church service 10am

properties.title: Bromley Salvation Army

properties.description: The church is open most weekdays for users who hire rooms and the public has access to the vestibule at those times. Bromley Homeless and the Bromley Food Bank (open for referrals on Tuesdays and Thursdays) both have permanent space on the premises. We run a cafe for refreshments (teas, coffees, biscuits, cake) on Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 10.00 am to 12 noon. The cost of a hot drink is £1 and biscuits etc are 50p.
